This game consists of a grid which several cells. Each cell has a number which represents its value. If the value is 0, means that the cell is deactivated. Otherwise the cell is activated.\n\n Recognise an activated cell is easy, because its bakground is filled with the proper color (the default cell is green). Now you will see how they look:
Tip: When you touch a cell, keep it touched and you will see marked all the cells which will change its value.

The objective of the game is activating all the green cells (with value equal to 1) and, if there are red ones, setting them value 0. To change the value of a cell you must press it and is probable that more cells will change their value at the same time.

In the game there are 2 cell types:

 Green: Are the default ones. To go to the next level they must be activated.
Red: They are security bits. All this cells have to be deactivated.\n\n

This game has several game modes which will be explained ahead.\n\n

Puzzle mode is a game mode which the player solves some puzzles. If the player want to play a puzzle, first he must have solved all the previous ones. Each puzzle measures the number of touches done and the time which it lasted. The less time the player solve the puzzle and the less touches he do, the more he scores.

When you finish a puzzle you get a score depending on the touches and the time.\nIf both the time and the touches are less than the optimal values, the button becomes blue. If you only achieve the optimal time or the optimal touches, it becomes orange.\n
Next you will see the different states which the puzzle can be finished:\n\n

It shows what represents each column of the menu. Memory position tells what level it is.
The watch indicates the spent time in which the player solved the puzzle.
The touch label is self-explanatory.

Puzzle with low score. The puzle has been completed, but the time or the touches were higher than the required.
Puzzle with high score. It has been completed with the optimal time and touches.

Tip: The number of touches only is increased when any cell changes its value.\nIf you touch some cell and you don\'t like the possible result, keep touched the screen and release your finger when it is out of the grid.\n
As well as the puzzle mode the player must solve several puzzles.\nHowever, there is one difference: The player begin with an amount of time available which is counting down.\n
The score is calculated using the total number of touches and the number of puzzles solved.
